overview_of_class: This course considers normal human movement; pathological conditions resulting from disease, injury, malformations, birth, etc.; and engineering approaches such as prostheses (limb replacements) and orthoses (limb assists) that may be able to ameliorate the conditions and promote improved movement and function. An objective of the course is to try to bring together technical analysis and synthesis skills of students with the practical problems of persons disabled by amputation, stroke, spinal cord injury, and other causes.
name: Control of Human Limbs and Their  Artificial Replacements
title: MEAS BMD_ENG 365-0-1 Control of Human Limbs and Their  Artificial Replacements

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
